cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 mi WSW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward toward the Florida Big Bend, then across northern Florida and southeastern Georgia into the Atlantic Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key/Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL, and Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central and northern Florida Gulf Coast, then Atlantic coasts of Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40–50 mph with higher gusts) expected Monday afternoon through late evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in and near Tampa Bay around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized totals up to 8 inches, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday and Monday night across the Florida peninsula, including the Tampa Bay area.
